content: Anyone mind if I extend -Zls to show more info about the crate? Right now it just shows the dependency indices and paths, but nothing else - not even the expected hash. It also doesn't show anything about the crate itself (for example name, hash). I have some local extensions I'm using to explore https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/86044 which I'm using as part of a test. But maybe there's another option? @bjorn3 has a outdated (dead?) tool to dump rmeta, which could also serve this role.
